description: Watch burning buoys float on a river while listening to spa music and eating food. Yep, seriously.
imgAlt: A dancing flame set against a black background

description: Interact with amazing animals (you can feed the giraffes!), ride the zipline and historic carousel, and take a trip on a paddle boat.
imgAlt: A giraffe extending its long purple tongue to reach a leaf on a high branch

description: A somewhat dangerous, 3.5 mile walk along the mansion-adorned cliffs of Newport. Spectacular views.
imgAlt: A rocky cliff along the right, with gentle waves lapping against them from the right. Mansions are set back along the top of the cliff.

description: Tour a bunch of snooty old summer homes built partially with slave-trade money that occupy some of the best real estate in the state. Seriously, why do people like this one?
imgAlt: The back of a mansion from the 1800s, with a marble patio flanked by two short stone stairways.

description: Indulge in a Rhode Island tradition: chowdah and clam cakes after a day at the beach. Iggy's, directly next door, is actually better, but this place is more popular.
imgAlt: A bowl of ice, with four cooked lobsters in it, and a sign that reads, 'Lobsters'

description: Try a unique Rhode Island delicacy: pizza strips. No, they're not just marinara and bread. Yes, they're frickin' delicious. Don't get confused and visit J. Palmieri's Bakery (also in Johnston), or Palmieri's Bakery (in Providence). Totally different places, nowhere near as good.
imgAlt: A deli cooler filled with pizzas and colones. Each one has a sign with a description and price.

description: The farm team for the Boston Red Sox. Take the whole family out for a game and hot dogs for under $50.
location: McCoy Stadium, 1 Columbus Avenue, Pawtucket, RI 02860
imgAlt: A dirty baseball on the dirty of a baseball diamond. A plate and two more baseballs are fuzzy in the background.

description: Eat at some of the best restaurants in the state and take a look at the giant metal pine cone (that looks likea pineapple) and find yourself asking, simply, "why?"
imgAlt: A plate filled with homemade pasta, tomatoes on the vine, eggs, and fresh basil.
